newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada approves four pay-audio licences.
newsitem.headline: Canada approves four pay-audio licences.

text.p: The Canadian Radio-television and Telecommunications Commission said on Friday that it confirmed earlier decisions awarding seven-year licenses for four pay-audio stations.
The four are: DMX Canada (controlled by Shaw Communications Inc ), Allegro, CBC Galaxie and Power Music Choice.
Allegro and Galaxie will offer pay audio packages consisting of programming entirely produced in Canada.

The other two licensees will provide a mix of Canadian and foreign-produced material. All must comply with rules for 30 percent Canadian content. The Canadian channels must also include some French-language music.
